intro: Sessea andina, commonly known as the Andean sesse, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems, often growing in rocky or mountainous terrain. It has adapted to harsh environmental conditions, such as strong winds and low temperatures. Sessea andina is also valued for its ornamental qualities and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
